answers.answer: Have a physical exam with labs to find out if you have diabetes, thyroid disease, or high cholesterol / hyperlipidemia.Eat vegetables and don't eat junk food, sugar.  No soda or sweet drinks.  Eat whole fruit instead.Try L-arginine to improve blood flow.  Exercise such as running will up your testosterone.  Lift some weights in a sensible way, using good form.  Not huge weights.  Get some training.

question: Hi,almost a year back i was having a very good sex life, bt at that time i was smoking a lot and not eating much food. after some time my gf started complaing that my penis is getting a bit soft and she doesnt get the same pleasure she used to get. what can be the reason to this and how can i overcome this. i dont smoke that much now...and try to eat as much as i can. this thing is curable i suppose..?? help guys..
title: penis not so hard it used to be.
